channel.title: Help with a mongoloid friend
channel.description:
Well I have a retarded friend who is like yeah man I wanna do sum java. I tell him to get jdk, batch file, etc but he isnt a catcher on-er.
So his question is, [b]Is there something like Dev-C++ but for java?[/b] where you can run shit with the click of a button etc.

item.title: Help with a mongoloid friend
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“belbn, post:28, topic:241378”][quote author=magma link=topic=317715.msg2530519#msg2530519 date=1226433810]

Do you guys want a picture of this kid and his book? I previously stated java is fucking gay and I personally hate it.

None of us would really know if the picture is of you and your book, or if it really is your imaginary friend.

But post anyway
[/quote]

For fuck sake Can I delete this topic? Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions.

[quote]3) Most Java Programmers are Morons

This has to do with the number of people in the world that describe themselves as Java programmers and work at day jobs doing Java programming. What are there, like 2 million of them? More? So it’s just a numbers thing, really. There just aren’t that many good programmers overall in the world – and most them wouldn’t be caught dead doing Java.[/quote][/quote]
Don’t listen to magma or any of those, they’ve probably never even compiled any bit of Java code, but they still wish to bash themselves around this part of the forum, doesn’t make sense, but oh well.

[quote=“the bank, post:29, topic:241378”]

Where can I get a copy?[/quote]
That’s highly appropriate considering you’re not very good when it comes to the language too, shut up.

Read full topic

[/quote]
None of us would really know if the picture is of you and your book, or if it really is your imaginary friend.

But post anyway :)[/quote]

For fuck sake Can I delete this topic? Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions, Assumptions.

3) Most Java Programmers are Morons

This has to do with the number of people in the world that describe themselves as Java programmers and work at day jobs doing Java programming. What are there, like 2 million of them? More? So it’s just a numbers thing, really. There just aren’t that many good programmers overall in the world – and most them wouldn’t be caught dead doing Java.

item.title: Help with a mongoloid friend
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

I understand him.

Steps for C++ / DevC++:

  1. Google for Bloodshed Dev C++.
  2. Download Bloodshed Dev C++.
  3. Install Bloodshed Dev C++.
  4. Write your code.
  5. Compile.

Steps for Java / Eclipse:

  1. Google for Java. -> Sun’s Page.
  2. Surf through a huge & fugly site full of acronyms such as JEE, JRE, JVM, SDK till you find JDK or equivalent.
  3. Download JDK.
  4. Install JDK.
  5. Go to your Windows Operative System advanced settings and modify your environment settings to add the bin path.
  6. Google for Eclipse.
  7. Download Eclipse, dealing again with a few acronyms. (EE Eclipse, Eclipse CRT, Eclipse for Java…).
  8. Configure Eclipse to use the JDK you have just installed / Set up Workspace, etc.
  9. Create a new Eclipse project.
  10. Compile.

There is no Bloodshed Dev C++ style IDE for Java that I know of, but you can refer to my steps above, lol.

Read full topic
